Articles.Content:
Also, I REALLY WANT TO SEE OMS AND VERNIERS!

http://youtu.be/TMDc_cCjSlE?t=1m28s

Here you go!

VERNIERS! OMS! Yes!

EDIT: Ninja'd, so I'll use this post to add something useful.

THIS might be technically an early-early-early access version of 0.24.

Edited July 14, 2014 by GregroxMun

http://youtu.be/TMDc_cCjSlE?t=1m28s

Here you go!

I'll take your word for it. That video was so incredibly annoying I had to turn it off after like 30 seconds.

Good to see the new vid uploaded. Too bad work just got busy for me. I'll be away for the next 12hours or so.

Is it me, or does Scott Manley sound a little under the weather in his vid?

As a PR firm, Squad would not let an important moment like this go unsupervised.

The marketing side of Squad acts separate from the KSP team. That said, while the initial videos were released a little earlier than it should have, it's ok. Starting today, the veil is lifted on the media team's work on First Contract.
I wonder how many modders are sitting there spamming F5 so they can update ASAP. Someone at Squad hurry up and hit the "RELEASE .24" button already!
When is the FAQ going to be released? (Please dont answer this in the FAQ)

Danny, "rescuing" a random Kerbanaut.

Where do random stranded Kerbanauts come from? I mean, In-game lore-wise, not code-wise. Are there other space programs, does the Kersoviet Space Program kidnap engineers from VacCo or Flooyd Dynamics? Are they from other player's Space Programs, secretly launching from the same site?

Also, I REALLY WANT TO SEE OMS AND VERNIERS!

Perhaps all Kerbals come from space, and the ones on Kerbin are merely the few who were lucky enough to lithobrake with their heads?

It is finally time....

Tomorrow, Tomorrow, i'll love you tomorrow, you're only a day away!

It is finally time....

Tomorrow, Tomorrow, i'll love you tomorrow, you're only a day away!

NO!

Today, Today, I'll love you TODAY, you're only a F5 away!
Did I see in one of those videos that there was an x64 version (64-bit) with the .24 update?

Did I see in one of those videos that there was an x64 version (64-bit) with the .24 update?

Yes, that was confirmed some time ago in a devnote.
I'm really impressed by the contracts. They sound like a lot of fun and give objectives that you wouldn't necessarily go for yourself (like trying out certain parts at certain altitudes).

When is the FAQ going to be released? (Please dont answer this in the FAQ)

LOL this would be so "SQUAD".

I'll try to keep this updated, but here is (hopefully) a Youtube playlist with all the videos in them:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLf79AQmcdZFqdPEaoYID848qb-nLzJFwM

the best part about this update for me is the fact that contracts will give me something to strive for instead of saying to myself "what now" i can instead go look at the contracts and pick something however i am also really excited for the new engines.

http://youtu.be/TMDc_cCjSlE?t=1m28s

Here you go!

Ok that was unexpected the RCS powered engines are radially attached i was hoping for inline but still super cool

Trapped at work... I can either migrate the Rube Goldberg-style Integration Services crap-packages the diseased minds on the ETL team (who I will soon beat ruthlessly) came up with, or I can stare blankly into space telling myself that release will happen before I get home.

I shall stare, nibble nails, and hit F5...
It's like waiting at the baggage carousel at the airport....

When is the FAQ going to be released? (Please dont answer this in the FAQ)

That's a great idea!

Today or tomorrow depending on approvals.

It's like waiting at the baggage carousel at the airport....

That's an incredibly accurate analogy.

the best part about this update for me is the fact that contracts will give me something to strive for instead of saying to myself "what now" i can instead go look at the contracts and pick something however i am also really excited for the new engines.

Ok that was unexpected the RCS powered engines are radially attached i was hoping for inline but still super cool

If you look closely, you see that the RCS powered engines can also work as RCS. If they were inline that nice little feature would be nearly useless.

I'll try to keep this updated, but here is (hopefully) a Youtube playlist with all the videos in them:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLf79AQmcdZFqdPEaoYID848qb-nLzJFwM

Thanks! +rep

That, plus 64 bits, which means *all the mods ever* since it removes the RAM cap for the process (well, increases it to 64GB).

*17 200 000 000gb10charlimitalsocorrected.Why are you reading this.

Edited July 14, 2014 by EvilotionCR2
C'mon tell us a date squad I won't go anywhere on release day.

If you look closely, you see that the RCS powered engines can also work as RCS. If they were inline that nice little feature would be nearly useless.

yeah that's true either way its something to look forward to as well
